# update()

**Instance Method**

Called by Cocoa when the view’s window moves or when the view itself moves or is resized.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func update()
```

## Discussion

The default implementation simply calls the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSOpenGLContext/update()] method of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSOpenGLContext]. You can override this method to perform additional update operations on the context or if you need to add locks for multithreaded access to multiple contexts.

## Managing the Visible Region

- **reshape()**: Called by Cocoa when the view’s visible rectangle or bounds change.
